name: physical_protection
title: Physical Protection
description: Physical Protection (Limit physical access to information systems and facilities)
purpose: To safeguard information assets and facilities by implementing physical access controls, monitoring mechanisms, and security measures that prevent unauthorized entry or physical intrusion.

item.text: How many individuals are authorized for physical access to FCI areas (fill in the total for each)?
Maintain an updated list of individuals authorized to access secure physical areas to ensure proper access control.
What areas require controlled physical access?

valueCoding.display: Conference rooms used for FCI discussions

item.text: Control and restrict access to sensitive physical locations to prevent unauthorized entry and protect assets.
Who authorizes physical access to controlled areas?
Establish formal procedures to grant, review, and revoke physical access permissions for personnel.
What types of physical access credentials are issued?
Issue and manage secure access credentials to verify and control entry to restricted physical areas.
Are there time-based restrictions on physical access?
Limit physical access to authorized areas during specific times to reduce security risks outside business hours.
Limit physical access to organizational information systems, equipment, and the respective operating environments to authorized individuals
Does your organization require all visitors to be escorted?

valueCoding.display: Yes, all visitors must be escorted at all times
Yes, but only in restricted areas

item.text: Require authorized personnel to accompany visitors while they are in secure areas to ensure safety and security.
How are visitors identified and distinguished from employees?
Implement procedures to verify and record visitor identities before granting physical access to facilities.
How is visitor activity monitored while on premises?

valueCoding.display: Physical access restrictions to sensitive areas

item.text: Track and record visitor movements within facilities to detect and prevent unauthorized activities.
Who is authorized to escort visitors?
Define who is permitted to escort visitors and ensure they understand their responsibilities for security and supervision.
Escort visitors and monitor visitor activity
How do you log physical access to your facilities?

valueCoding.display: Electronic badge readers with automatic logging
Physical key assignment and tracking logs

item.text: Implement methods to accurately record entry and exit activities in secure areas for audit and investigation purposes.
What information is captured in your physical access logs Information Captured in Logs?

valueCoding.display: Person's identity (name, employee ID, visitor ID)

item.text: Record key details such as date, time, personnel identity, and access points to ensure comprehensive tracking of physical access events.
How long are physical access logs retained?
How frequently are access logs reviewed?
Who reviews the physical access logs?
Maintain and regularly review access logs to detect anomalies and support security investigations.
What types of physical access devices does your organization use?

answerOption.valueString: Biometric scanners (fingerprint, retina, etc.) Smart cards with embedded chips
Mobile phone apps for access control

item.text: Keep an up-to-date inventory of all devices used to control physical access, such as card readers and locks, to ensure proper management and security.
How are physical access devices controlled and managed?

answerOption.valueString: Device return procedures for departing employees
Procedures for lost or stolen devices
Ability to quickly revoke device access

item.text: Implement procedures to configure, monitor, and maintain physical access devices to prevent unauthorized use or tampering.
What security measures protect physical access devices?

answerOption.valueString: Device expiration dates and automatic deactivation

item.text: Apply security controls to protect physical access devices from damage, tampering, or unauthorized modification.
How frequently are electronic access systems updated?
Regularly perform maintenance and apply updates to physical access devices to ensure their reliability and security.
